# jsdoc/require-param-type <Badge type="info" text="Pedantic" />

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

Requires that each `@param` tag has a type value (within curly brackets).

### Why is this bad?

The type of a parameter should be documented.

### Example

```javascript
// Passing
/** @param {SomeType} foo */
function quux(foo) {}

// Failing
/** @param foo */
function quux(foo) {}
```

## References

- [Rule Source](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/blob/main/crates/oxc_linter/src/rules/jsdoc/require_param_type.rs)
